    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Dero Stalker</h1>Dero stalkers are those charged with exploring the surface world by night and seeking out new victims to abduct.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Humanoid</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=14">Society</a></u>)</b>: DC 16<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=105">Dero Stalker</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 2</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Dero_DeroStalker.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Dero_DeroStalker.png"></a><span alt="Chaotic Evil" class="traitalignment" title="Chaotic Evil">CE</span><span alt="Small" class="traitsize" title="Small">Small</span><span alt="Dero Trait" class="trait" title="This family of humanoids are the descendants of fey creatures that fell into darkness and confusion after being abandoned in the Darklands. They are immune to confusion and vulnerable to sunlight."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=214">Dero</a></span><span alt="Humanoid Trait" class="trait" title="Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=91">Humanoid</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 84</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +5; darkvision<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=13"><u>Aklo</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=11"><u>Undercommon</a></u><br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=1"><u>Acrobatics</a></u> +8, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=9"><u>Medicine</a></u> +3, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=15"><u>Stealth</a></u> +8, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=17"><u>Thievery</a></u> +8<br /><b>Str</b> +2, <b>Dex</b> +4, <b>Con</b> +3, <b>Int</b> +0, <b>Wis</b> -1, <b>Cha</b> +1<br /><b>Items</b> <a href="Weapons.aspx?ID=85"><u>aklys</u></a>, <a href="Equipment.aspx?ID=113"><u>giant centipede venom (4 doses)</u></a>, <a href="Weapons.aspx?ID=69"><u>hand crossbow (20 bolts)</u></a><hr /><b>AC</b> 19, <b>Fort</b> +7, <b>Ref</b> +10, <b>Will</b> +3<br /><b>HP</b> 30; <b>Weaknesses</b> vulnerable to sunlight<br /><b>Vulnerable to Sunlight</b> A dero stalker takes 4 damage for every hour they’re exposed to sunlight.<br /> <b>Nimble Dodge</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction_I.png"> <b>Requirements</b> The dero stalker is not encumbered. <b>Trigger</b> A creature targets the dero with an attack and the dero can see the attacker. <b>Effect</b> The dero dodges out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.<hr /><b>Speed</b> 20 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> aklys +8 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=196"><u>trip</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d6+2 bludgeoning</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Ranged</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> aklys +10 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=251"><u>ranged trip</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=252"><u>tethered</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=195"><u>thrown 20 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d6+2 bludgeoning</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Ranged</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> hand crossbow +10 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=248"><u>range increment 60 feet</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=254"><u>reload 1</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d6 piercing plus <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Equipment.aspx?ID=113">giant centipede venom</a></span><b>Occult Innate Spells</b> DC 17; <b>Cantrips</b> <b>(1st)</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=61">daze</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=132">ghost sound</a></u></i><br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Sneak Attack</b> A dero stalker deals 1d6 extra precision damage to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=16">flat-footed</a> creatures.</span><h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=29">Dero</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=107">Dero Magister</a></td><td>5</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=105">Dero Stalker</a></td><td>2</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=106">Dero Strangler</a></td><td>3</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=29">Dero</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 84</i></a><br />Deros are short, wiry humanoids with milky white eyes, gray-blue skin, and wild shocks of off-white or gray hair. The descendants of a mysterious type of fey abandoned in the deepest, darkest caverns of Golarion, deros are the subject of fearful legends and folk tales to most of the world’s surface races. They skulk beneath major metropolitan areas, performing cruel and twisted experiments on unwilling subjects. A dero is 3 feet tall and weighs approximately 70 pounds.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Cytillesh</h3>Deros grow and ingest a poisonous fungus called cytillesh, also known as brain mold. Cytillesh gives off a pale blue glow and can cause birth defects and various adverse effects. Deros aren’t fazed by these detriments, as prolonged exposure can also slow the effects of aging and, in rare cases, provide occult powers to certain individuals known as “magisters.” Deros can also brew cytillesh spores into a poison that creates delusions and hallucinations.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> The Sun! It Burns!</h3>Deros are fixated with curing their allergy to sunlight. To understand how the surface dwellers can withstand the light of the sun, deros conduct late-night raids on surface cities, abducting victims and performing terrible experiments on them. Those who survive are often returned with much of their memory erased and their bodies bearing mysterious scars. When these repressed memories surface, they lead to wild, hazy recollections of being abducted.</span>

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));
      initializeMenuToggle(document.getElementById('minMaxMenu'));
      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
</body>
</html>
